awards.summary: Received the scholarship for being in the top 10 taking a Computer Science exam requiring both practical and theory, letting me skip from Year 12 High School to Second Year University Papers
awards.title: 2014 Computer Science Scholarship

basics.label: Founding member NYRIAD™ Limited
basics.name: Tyler W Hale
basics.summary:
• Developer who likes to explore different areas of programming, you will typically see me trying out faster and more automated ways to improve CI/CD, machine infrastructure and anything else that causes developer friction.

• Heavily involved in building infrastructure that supports Nvidia GPUs as well as effective storage and data science stacks that use them. This lead me to following Dev-Ops practises and has been a key aspect of working with tools such as Kubernetes, Kibana, Docker, Terraform, Ansible, and Jenkins.

• Started programming in high-school, leaving a year early with a scholarship to Waikato University while simultaneously being part of building Nyriad. I have actively jumped into new and existing projects where I have helped with leadership, management, and development problem solving.

courses: Artificial Intelligence Techniques and Applications - COMP316-16A
Design and Analysis of Algorithms - COMP317-17A
Introduction to 3D Modelling and Animation - COMP221-15B

highlights: • LUCE a containerized GPU data-science stack for Scion to process its New Zealand LiDAR data
• Nsulate integrations into distributed storage systems
• Various internal tools and dashboards for developers
work.position: Software Developer, Development Lead, Sales Engineer
work.summary: One of the first to join, have been actively involed throughout the entire journey. Part of Product Management; Working on strategy, feature definition, road-mapping and release process.
